snp3.4:5.3: Norman and Bodhi both follow comm. here without comment: _manussehi_. But _māṇava_ is not used elsewhere in this sense (PTS Dict’s ref to Thig 7.1 notwithstanding). The context is the Buddha’s unattachment to “clan” and it surely has the sense here of “youngling”, either children or students.
snp3.4:11.2: Norma and Bodhi both have "approach and ask", but _upasaṅkamma_ is abolutive: he is already there.
